Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CCDC::CCDC ( CUsbDriver *  usbDriver,
CBoard *  board,
CEventSink *  eventSink 
)

Initializes a CDC serial driver.

This method sets the standard descriptors of the device and the default CDC configuration.

Parameters:
usbDriver Pointer to the CUsbDriver instance to use
eventSink Pointer to the CEventSink driver instance to use
This method sets the standard descriptors of the device and the default CDC configuration.
Parameters:
usbDriver USB driver instance that servers this object
board Hardware board abstraction instance
eventSink Event sink isntance that handles this object

Member Function Documentation

void CCDC::OnSetLineCoding ( CCDC *  pThis  )  [static, private]

Sets asynchronous line-character formatting properties.

This function is used as a callback when receiving the data part of a SET_LINE_CODING request.

See also:
usbcdc11.pdf - Section 6.2.12
This function is used as a callback when receiving the data part of a SET_LINE_CODING request.
See also:
usbcdc11.pdf - Section 6.2.12

EnumStandardReturnValue USB::CCDC::Read ( void *  pBuffer,
uint  dLength,
Callback_f  fCallback,
void *  pArgument 
) [inline]

Reads data from the Data OUT endpoint.

Parameters:
pBuffer Buffer in which to store the received data
dLength Length of data buffer
fCallback Optional callback function
pArgument Optional parameter for the callback function
Returns:
SER_STATUS_SUCCESS if transfer has started successfully; SER_STATUS_LOCKED if endpoint is currently in use; SER_STATUS_ERROR if transfer cannot be started.

uint  dLength,
Callback_f  fCallback = 0,
void *  pArgument = 0,
const void *  pBufferLowerBound = 0,
const void *  pBufferUpperBound = 0 
) [inline]

Sends data through the Data IN endpoint.

Parameters:
pBuffer Buffer holding the data to transmit
dLength Length of data buffer
fCallback Optional callback function
pBufferLowerBound Lower bound of the circular buffer
pBufferUpperBound Upper bound of the circular buffer
pArgument Optional parameter for the callback function
Returns:
SER_STATUS_SUCCESS if transfer has started successfully; SER_STATUS_LOCKED if endpoint is currently in use; SER_STATUS_ERROR if transfer cannot be started.
